description.value:
Trigger At least two living creatures step on the staircase

Effect Dozens of mouths open on the stairs and eastern wall doors of the chamber and howl in anger and misery. Creatures in the area are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Deafened] for 2 rounds and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 2} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save. Creatures who critically fail are deafened for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 3}. The haunt then rolls initiative.

details.description: The faces of the original dwarven inhabitants of the city appear in the stone and scream in anger.
details.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:23] (trained) to ritually pray for the dead or @Check[type:occultism|dc:25] (trained) to exorcise the spirits' anger; a dwarf succeeds at a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:22] or Intimidate check, asking or ordering the spirits to stand down.

publication.title: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm

details.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 round after all living creatures leave the area. After 1 hour, the haunt reactivates. If the haunt is disabled by a dwarf succeeding at a Diplomacy or Intimidate check, the haunt is destroyed.
details.routine: (1 action) The faces continue to scream, dealing @Damage[5d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save) to all living creatures within 20 feet of the steps. On a critical failure, a creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Deafened] for 1 round. Deaf creatures are immune to this effect.
